definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Metallurgists of the time are not thought to have known about this technique.
sentences.chinese: 人們認爲當時的冶金學家並不瞭解這種技術。

sentences.english: The metallurgical principles of the above results are studied, also.
sentences.chinese: 本文對試驗結果還進行了冶金學原理的分析。

sentences.english: In 21 century, the development of metallurgy and material manufacture should be two tendency.
sentences.chinese: 21世紀中冶金學及材料製備學的發展在於兩個方向。

sentences.english: But the metallurgist uses the word in relation to a wide variety of processes.
sentences.chinese: 但是冶金學家用這個詞來表述很多過程。

sentences.english: In 1913 Harry Brearley, a metallurgist, was trying to find a metal suitable for making gun barrels.
sentences.chinese: 冶金學家是決定哪種金屬最合適於某種用途的科學家。

sentences.english: And, as an extractive metallurgist, that took the cake.
sentences.chinese: 作爲提煉冶金學家，當然會喜歡這個。

sentences.english: The metallurgist is a scientist who decides which material is most suitable for each purpose.
sentences.chinese: 冶金學家是決定哪種金屬最合適於某種用途的科學家。

sentences.english: It can be classified as process metallurgy and physical metallurgy.
sentences.chinese: 它可以分爲過程冶金學和物理冶金學。

sentences.english: It can be classified as process metallurgy and physical metallurgy.
sentences.chinese: 它可以分爲過程冶金學和物理冶金學。
